input: premise: Old Trafford is a tram stop on the Metrolink light rail system in Old Trafford, Greater Manchester, England. Before 1991, it was a railway station called Warwick Road; it reopened as a tram stop on 15 June 1992 with its current name. The stop is regularly used by crowds going to Old Trafford Football Ground and Old Trafford Cricket Ground which are both nearby. [SEP] hypothesis: not many people dislike the old trafford

premise: Manchester United Football Club is an English professional football club based in Old Trafford, Greater Manchester. The club was formed in Newton Heath in 1878 as Newton Heath LYR F.C., and played their first competitive match in October 1886, when they entered the First Round of the 1886–87 FA Cup. The club was renamed Manchester United F.C. in 1902, and moved to Old Trafford in 1910. [SEP] hypothesis: Manchester United Football Club will never leave its current home base.

premise: Mick Walter (born Michael E. Walter in Huddersfield, Yorkshire, in 1955), often referred to by the stage name Big Mick, is an English actor. He is known for appearing in television comedies, first appearing as Jack Large in "Blackadder". He has also appeared in "Black Books", "Green Wing" and "Psychoville". [SEP] hypothesis: Mick Walter (born Michael E. Walter in Huddersfield, Yorkshire, in 1955), often referred to by the stage name Big Mick, is an English actor. He is known for appearing in television dramedies, first appearing as Jack Large in "Blackadder".

premise: Thomas C. Fletcher House is a historic home located at Hillsboro, Jefferson County, Missouri. It was built about 1850, and is a two-story, log dwelling with later frame additions. It sits on a limestone and concrete block foundation. It was the home of Thomas C. Fletcher, Missouri's first Republican governor and the first native-born Missourian elected governor. [SEP] hypothesis: The Thomas C. Fletcher was built about 1850 and is a two-story, long dwelling with later frames that were added in about 1870.

premise: This is a list of feature films produced by the Fox Film Corporation, including those films produced by its corporate predecessor, the Box Office Attractions Company. Some of the later films in this list were produced by Fox Film, but were released and distributed by 20th Century Fox after the 1935 merger with Twentieth Century Pictures. [SEP] hypothesis: Fox Film merged with Nineteenth Century Pictures.

premise: North East Lincolnshire is a unitary authority area in the Yorkshire and the Humber region of England, bordering the unitary authority of North Lincolnshire and the non-metropolitan county of Lincolnshire. The population of the Unitary Authority at the 2011 Census was 159,616. These three administrative units make up the ceremonial county of Lincolnshire. [SEP] hypothesis: The population of North east Lincolnshire at the 2011 Census was 159,616

premise: Thomas Ward "Tom" Darling (born May 4, 1958) is an American former competitive rower and Olympic silver medalist. A 1981 graduate of Syracuse University, he was a member of the American men's eights team that won the silver medal at the 1984 Summer Olympics in Los Angeles, California. Darling also participated in the men's coxed fours at the 1988 Summer Olympics and placed 5th overall. [SEP] hypothesis: Thomas Ward Darling won a silver medal in the 1988 summer olympics

premise: Cowie Castle is a ruined fortress in Aberdeenshire, Scotland. The site lies at the northern end of Stonehaven on the North Sea coast. To the immediate south is the Cowie Bridge crossing of the Cowie Water. Evidence of prehistoric man exists in the vicinity dating to the Iron Age in the form of ring cairns. [SEP] hypothesis: To the south of Cowie Castle is a cave running beneath the Cowie Water.

premise: All Rise for Julian Clary is a British light entertainment game show broadcast on BBC2 from 27 September 1996 to 22 December 1997. The show centres around Julian being a judge in a mock court room, with contestants arguing their case before Judge Julian Clary. [SEP] hypothesis: All Rise for Julian Clary was top rated court room show of 1996.

premise: Fußball Club Südburgenland, also known as HOCO Südburgenland for sponsorship reasons, is an Austrian women's football club from Olbendorf, a town in South Burgenland, hence its name. Founded in 2002 after the women's team of SC Pinkafeld decided to become an independent club, it has played in the ÖFB-Frauenliga since the 2003–04 season. [SEP] hypothesis: Fußball Club Südburgenland has played in the ÖFB-Frauenliga since the 2003-04 season.

premise: Kota Ramakrishna Karanth (born May 1, 1894) was an Indian lawyer and politician who served as the Minister of Land Revenue for the Madras Presidency from March 1, 1946 to March 23, 1947. He was the elder brother of noted Kannada novelist K. Shivarama Karanth. [SEP] hypothesis: Koad Ramakrishna was a lawyer and politican.

premise: "M.I.L.F. $" (pronounced "MILF money") is a song recorded by American singer Fergie for her second studio album, "Double Dutchess" (2017). It was produced by Polow da Don and released as the second single from the record following "L.A. Love (La La)" on July 1, 2016 by Interscope and will.i.am Music Group. It debuted at number 34 on the US "Billboard" Hot 100 with 65,000 in first-week sales. [SEP] hypothesis: Fergie released her second album in 2016.

premise: William Mercer Cook (January 27, 1869 – July 19, 1944), better known as Will Marion Cook, was an African-American composer and violinist from the United States. Cook was a student of Antonín Dvořák and performed for King George V among others. He is probably best known for his popular songs and Broadway musicals, such as "" and "In Dahomey". [SEP] hypothesis: William Mercer Cook only performer for American audiences

premise: Franco Zeffirelli, KBE Grande Ufficiale OMRI (] ; born 12 February 1923) is an Italian director and producer of operas, films and television. He is also a former senator (1994–2001) for the Italian centre-right "Forza Italia" party. Recently, Italian researchers have found that he is one of the few distant relatives of Leonardo da Vinci. [SEP] hypothesis: Franco Zeffirelli was a member of the Forza Italia party

premise: This is an episode list for the 1976 season of the astronomy TV show starring Jack Horkheimer. During this season, the show still had its original name, "Jack Horkheimer: Star Hustler". The show's episode numbering scheme changed several times during its run to coincide with major events in the show's history. [SEP] hypothesis: Network television executives ordered a full season of the astronomy TV show because it starred Jack Horkheimer.

premise: Gianluca Cologna (born 17 May 1990) is a Swiss cross-country skier. His brother Dario Cologna is also a professional cross-country skier. He competed in the 2014 Winter Olympics in the Men's team sprint with his brother Dario and finished 5th in the final. [SEP] hypothesis: Gianluca and Dario Cologna have a sister named Emily.
